intro: Gochnatia obtusifolia, commonly known as the woolly gochnatia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, often glandular leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in dense, spherical clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. Gochnatia obtusifolia is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
